programme.title: Hollywood Buzz
programme.desc: W programie nowości kinowe, relacje z planów zdjęciowych oraz ciekawostki związanych z gwiazdami srebrnego ekranu. O pracy nad najnowszymi hollywoodzkimi produkcjami opowiadają ich twórcy - znani reżyserzy i aktorzy. Autorzy magazynu przedstawiają również zwiastuny filmów wchodzących na ekrany kin.

programme.title: The Monuments Men
Obrońcy skarbów
The Monuments Men
programme.desc:
The Monuments Men: Directed by George Clooney. With George Clooney, Matt Damon, Bill Murray, Cate Blanchett. An unlikely World War II platoon is tasked to rescue art masterpieces from Nazi thieves and return them to their owners." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2177771/","name":"The Monuments Men","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMxMjk4NTM1M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjg0MjQ3MDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"An unlikely World War II platoon is tasked to rescue art masterpieces from Nazi thieves and return them to their owners.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2177771/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"RyanCShowers"},"dateCreated":"2014-03-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"An Award Season Misfit Moved to a February Release","reviewBody":"In the early scenes of "The Monuments Men," director George Clooney introduces his supporting cast of characters portrayed by John Goodman, Bill Murray, and Bob Balaban. Humiliatingly sending this group of elderly actors through physical fitness trainings before the film transitions into its World War II plot, the audience could confuse "The Monuments Men" with last November's "Last Vegas."'

"The Monuments Men" boasts an impressive advertisement to entice the interest of the public. The cast includes Matt Damon, Cate Blanchett, and Clooney himself; three reliable actors who can usually earn their films a stamp of approval. However, "The Monuments Men" deceives its audience with a promise of a quality storyline that features American soldiers searching to retrieve irreplaceable art that Hitler and the Nazis have stolen from France.

George Clooney may have been on the path of becoming the next Warren Beatty, a heartthrob actor turned serious director, until "The Monuments Men." His direction is not the film's sorest aspect, but the directing itself is substantially weaker than the skills he has shown recently with "The Ides of March" and "Good Night, and Good Luck." He attempts to run the story with a path in mind, but his attempts feel like his legs were injured while trying run on that path. The film's score adds an essence of floating patriotism, which offsets the comedic tone established by writing.

The difficulty of "The Monuments Men" is the screenplay. In addition to acting and directing, Clooney also wrote the screenplay with co-writer Grant Heslov for "The Monuments Men." The dialogue tries diligently to make clever cultural references and create amusing one-liners, but most of the written word in the script flops like a poorly made piece of sushi. I wonder if Clooney was consciously writing the script or if he was actually executing effort; if that is the case, my heart goes out to his lacking ability to write competent dialogue.

With those high-status actors, one would think they would be able to be the saving grace of "The Monuments Men." Sadly, the male actors show no signs of characterization, making their characters feel like extensions of their own personalities. The only performer who is marginally successful is Cate Blanchett. In her Oscar-winning performance in "Blue Jasmine," Blanchett played a character that arguably no other actress could portray except her. In contrast, her character, Claire in "The Monuments Men" is a role generic enough to be played by any aspiring actress. In her first scene, Claire spits into someone's drinking glass and my response was a sympathetic one, knowing Blanchett is capable of better work.

"The Monuments Men" wants to be a serious film, but falls back on comedy, becoming a real- life treasure hunt. Clooney attempts to force sentiment on his audience, but it is unearned and unwanted. "The Monuments Men" was originally set to release last December (a fitting release for pushing films in the Oscar race), but was moved to an alternative February. My guess is the studio realized "The Monuments Men" was nothing more than an award season misfit."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":128083,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2014-02-26","keywords":"art,art expert,nazi stolen art,1940s,world war two","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1176348697","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgxMzcyOTExNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDAzMzcyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgxMzcyOTExNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDAzMzcyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"In a race against time, a crew of art historians and museum curators unite to recover renowned works of art stolen by Nazis before Hitler destroys them. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000123/","name":"George Clooney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000354/","name":"Matt Damon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000195/","name":"Bill Murray"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000123/","name":"George Clooney"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017497/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0184096/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000123/","name":"George Clooney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0381416/","name":"Grant Heslov"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2603459/","name":"Robert M. Edsel"}],"duration":"PT1H58M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: My Cousin Vinny
Mój kuzyn Vinny
My Cousin Vinny
programme.desc:
My Cousin Vinny: Directed by Jonathan Lynn. With Joe Pesci, Ralph Macchio, Marisa Tomei, Mitchell Whitfield. Two New Yorkers accused of murder in rural Alabama while on their way back to college call in the help of one of their cousins, a loudmouth lawyer with no trial experience." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0104952/","name":"My Cousin Vinny","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxNDYzMTg1M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzk4MDgxMTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two New Yorkers accused of murder in rural Alabama while on their way back to college call in the help of one of their cousins, a loudmouth lawyer with no trial experience.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0104952/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Barky44"},"dateCreated":"2005-09-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Brilliant Film!","reviewBody":"My Cousin Vinny is one of the most brilliant comedies ever produced. There is simply so much to love about this movie.

First, this is not simply a slapstick comedy. Sure, there is some of that, including a few hilarious moments in the Alabama mud. But the dialogue in this film is terrifically funny. The writers were able to turn a courtroom script into an incredibly funny exchange of dialogue between lawyers, judges and witnesses. And the whole idea of an out-of-work hairdresser knowing about Positraction is simply brilliant.

This dialogue is brilliant because of excellent performances by both Marisa Tomei and Joe Pesci. These two sell this whole load of nonsense so beautifully it should be mandatory viewing for first-year drama students. These two actors show how talented people can read practically anything and make it not only funny but wholly believable.

Even all the side characters, from the judge to the D.A. to the defendants to the jury and witnesses are brilliantly played. Some of the exchanges between a local Alabama judge and a NYC poser lawyer would be completely ridiculous in anyone else's hands, but these people make it so real and so funny it's truly a thing of beauty.

This is one of those rare films that I can watch over and over again for hours and not tire of it.

10 out of 10 Barky","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":114262,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"1992-03-13","keywords":"lawyer,trial,italian american,alabama,jail","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"My Cousin Vinny","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2744844569","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjc2NWI4YjctMWVhMy00MGViLTk5NzQtZGMwYWY3MzQwZWZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjc2NWI4YjctMWVhMy00MGViLTk5NzQtZGMwYWY3MzQwZWZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000582/","name":"Joe Pesci"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000673/","name":"Marisa Tomei"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001494/","name":"Ralph Macchio"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0528718/","name":"Jonathan Lynn"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057987/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0731057/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0490958/","name":"Dale Launer"}],"duration":"PT2H"}</script><metacontent="

Julie Walters alongside Buckley was perfect also. Although their greatness on set did outshine most of the supporting cast who had a daytime cheap tv drama feel about them although this did not take to much away. A feel good romp of a film.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12418,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2019-04-12","keywords":"singer,country music singer,train,party,release from prison","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2535701529","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGYzMmUxM2MtMWZkYi00ZDk2LWFjN2YtMjI3ZDc1ZTVmMjc2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGYzMmUxM2MtMWZkYi00ZDk2LWFjN2YtMjI3ZDc1ZTVmMjc2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Fresh out of a stint in prison, Rose-Lynn is a single mom with an ankle monitor, a curfew, and a concerned mother (Julie Walters), who wants her to focus more on her two children and less on her music. programme.title: Radioactive
Skłodowska
Radioactive
programme.desc:
Radioactive: Directed by Marjane Satrapi. With Rosamund Pike, Yvette Feuer, Mirjam Novak, Ralph Berkin. The incredible true story of Marie Sklodowska-Curie and her Nobel Prize-winning work that changed the world." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6017756/","name":"Radioactive","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGZkNzY3MmUtYjJlNC00NTM0LWFiNmYtZDA4NzBiMmU1MzI4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODE0OTU5Nzg@._V1_.jpg","description":"The incredible true story of Marie Sklodowska-Curie and her Nobel Prize-winning work that changed the world.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6017756/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"tm-sheehan"},"dateCreated":"2021-03-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Dull Script & Direction Great performance by Rosamund Pike","reviewBody":"My Review- Radioactive (Prime Amazon) My rating 6/10

My 6/10 rating is for the film itself Rosamund Pike gets an 8:10 for her performance as Marie Curie the famous Nobel Winning Scientist who discovered the elements of Polinium and Radium.

She marries and forms a partnership with her husband Pierre (Sam Riley ) who also gives a fine performance in a very flawed script apparently filled with inaccuracies to add to the drama but in my view only adds to the dullness of this movie.

"Rotten Tomatoes " though similar to me "Radioactive's flawed script and counterproductive storytelling choices are offset by Rosamund Pike's central performance in a sincere tribute to a brilliant scientific mind.

The film is based on the graphic novel ''Radioactive: Marie & Pierre Curie: A Tale of Love and Fallout'' by Lauren Redniss. This is director Marjane Satrapi's first film based on a graphic novel that was not written by her. I think that is very obvious and shows her inexperience . The Screenplay by Jack Thorne is just dull and uninteresting I'm sure the book it's based on must be better.

There are intrusive and unnecessary and distracting references to the future effects of Marie Curie's contributions to Science depicting the future impact of her discoveries, including external beam radiotherapy at a hospital in Cleveland in 1956, the atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki, a nuclear bomb test in Nevada in 1961, and the Chernobyl disaster in 1986 it gives the impression or perhaps message that perhaps humanity may have been better off without her great discoveries?

Both the Curies experienced radium burns, both accidentally and voluntarily, and were exposed to extensive doses of radiation while conducting their research. They experienced radiation sickness and Marie Curie died of aplastic anemia in 1934. Even now, all their papers from the 1890s, even her cookbooks, are too dangerous to touch. Their laboratory books are kept in special lead boxes and people who want to see them have to wear protective clothing. Had Pierre Curie not been killed as he was, it is likely that he would have eventually died of the effects of radiation, as did his wife, their daughter Irène, and her husband Frédéric Joliot.

I'm a great fan of Rosamund Pike and enjoyed her performance in this very dull average film I suggest read the book or watch the far superior 1943 film with Greer Garson "Madam Curie." and Walter Pidgeon as Pierre.

It was nominated for 7 Oscars and a much better film directed by Mervyn LeRoy and based on Ève Curie the daughter of Madam Curie.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":15015,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Biography","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2020-06-15","keywords":"scientist,physicist,science,physics,chemistry","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1577631257","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWUxMzMxYWQtZjM5Mi00ZGYzLTgyNzUtZWFjNDQ5NTliYjBmXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWUxMzMxYWQtZjM5Mi00ZGYzLTgyNzUtZWFjNDQ5NTliYjBmXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg","description":"A story of the scientific and romantic passions of Marie Sklodowska-Curie (Polish scientist) and Pierre Curie, and the reverberation of their discoveries throughout the 20th century."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0683253/","name":"Rosamund Pike"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0275431/","name":"Yvette Feuer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1597296/","name":"Mirjam Novak"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2277869/","name":"Marjane Satrapi"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057311/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0319272/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2113666/","name":"Jack Thorne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9706688/","name":"Lauren Redniss"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Wedding Year
I znowu wesele
The Wedding Year
programme.desc: The Wedding Year: Directed by Robert Luketic. With Sarah Hyland, Tyler James Williams, Jenna Dewan, Matt Shively. A commitment-phobic 27 year old's relationship is put to the test when she and her new boyfriend go to 7 weddings in the same year." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8367184/","name":"The Wedding Year","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGU0ZDAxNjYtMTFlMi00MzY5LThhYmUtYWM5MTY1ODVmZTNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjI2ODA4MDU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A commitment-phobic 27 year old's relationship is put to the test when she and her new boyfriend go to 7 weddings in the same year.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8367184/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Gordon-11"},"dateCreated":"2019-11-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Really fun and enjoyable","reviewBody":"This film tells the story of a new couple who goes to seven weddings in a year.\n\nThe film is just so sweet and fun! There is just every element in it to make it work. There is a pretty girl, beautiful clothes, upbeat music, dancing, parties, and the obligatory gay best friend. The weddings adds to the main leads' romance, rather than distract, which is quite a feat. Berlin, I Love You
programme.desc: Berlin, I Love You: Directed by Dianna Agron, Peter Chelsom, Claus Clausen, Fernando Eimbcke, Justin Franklin, Dennis Gansel, Dani Levy, Daniel Lwowski, Stephanie Martin, Josef Rusnak, Til Schweiger, Massy Tadjedin, Gabriela Tscherniak. With Keira Knightley, Helen Mirren, Luke Wilson, Jim Sturgess. Latest installment of the Cities of Love series (Paris, je t'aime / New York, I Love You / Rio, Eu Te Amo), this collective feature film is made of ten stories of romance set in the German capital." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2275743/","name":"Berlin, I Love You","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDIwMTNlZmYtZGIxZS00MzAyLWI5MWMtYzg3YWNiNzg5YTI5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzQwMTY2Nzk@._V1_.jpg","description":"Latest installment of the Cities of Love series (Paris, je t'aime / New York, I Love You / Rio, Eu Te Amo), this collective feature film is made of ten stories of romance set in the German capital.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2275743/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Gordon-11"},"dateCreated":"2019-04-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's horrid","reviewBody":"This film is a collage of segments of people whose lives intersect in Berlin.\n\nWith this many big names, it is a surprise that the film is allowed to be a horrid mess. Just the first segment alone is enough to make me lose interest in the whole film. It is a bizarre short about a man and a GPS system, and it is just way too strange to be likable. The subsequent segments get no better, not even the one with Helen Mirren and Keira Knightley. The Berlin protrayed in the film is an unattractive dump, and it does not inspire any romantic feelings. Fortunately, there is one segment that is good, which is the puppet show one. It gives warmth and radiates attraction, which is the only segment that sticks to romantic love in Berlin."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2919,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2019-08-08","keywords":"portmanteau film,directed by several directors,punctuation in title,city name in title,female nudity","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Berlin, I Love You","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3909401113","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDU1NTgxM2MtZDAzYi00ZDVkLTk5MjItMGM5NzAwZmRmOGNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDU1NTgxM2MtZDAzYi00ZDVkLTk5MjItMGM5NzAwZmRmOGNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0461136/","name":"Keira Knightley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000545/","name":"Helen Mirren"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005561/","name":"Luke Wilson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1872698/","name":"Dianna Agron"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0155093/","name":"Peter Chelsom"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1313447/","name":"Claus Clausen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0671138/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0174940/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0228761/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0251774/","name":"Fernando Eimbcke"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3418586/","name":"Justin Franklin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0304541/","name":"Dennis Gansel"}],"duration":"PT2H"}</script><metacontent="

Serce świata
No coração do mundo
programme.desc: No Coração do Mundo: Directed by Gabriel Martins, Maurílio Martins. With Kelly Crifer, Leo Pyrata, Grace Passô, Bárbara Colen. The inhabitants of the Brazilian city of Contagem yearn for a better life. At the core of it all is Selma, a woman dreaming about the heart of the world: it could be anywhere, as long as it's a place where to feel happier." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9646768/","name":"No Coração do Mundo","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODY2MWQzOWMtYmE3ZS00NGM2LWFkYTAtOTQ3MDU4MmI0NTUzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyOTc4OTI5MDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The inhabitants of the Brazilian city of Contagem yearn for a better life. At the core of it all is Selma, a woman dreaming about the heart of the world: it could be anywhere, as long as it's a place where to feel happier.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9646768/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"guisreis"},"dateCreated":"2021-04-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Inside periphery, with real people","reviewBody":"Interesting and varied characters deeply developped in a realistic periphery in the town Contagem. The beginning is amazing, and the way we gradually know the different characters, how they are related to each other, and their lives is very engaging. Their existences are far from desired and they want to be somewhere else: if the needed profit will come from a new work or through a great crime, that will vary. Indeed, borders between crime and honest work are not always so rigid, and both are neighbors. Action scenes are as good as the daily routine ones, and here I saw one of the very best shooting footage. The only drawback, in my opinion, is that there are too many side stories which are not developped until the end, and some kmportant events are never explained or are just forgotten. The film is quite well directed and has excellent actors, and listening Minas Gerais accent is very nice.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":321,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-08-01","keywords":"male frontal nudity,male nudity,male rear nudity,female nudity,fireworks","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"In the Heart of the World (Official Trailer 2019)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2546908697","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmVlZDY2ZDktM2UxMC00ZGE4LTljYWUtYzcwNDhkMjZiMTJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQUlNRGJWaWRlb1RodW1ibmFpbFNlcnZpY2U@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmVlZDY2ZDktM2UxMC00ZGE4LTljYWUtYzcwNDhkMjZiMTJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQUlNRGJWaWRlb1RodW1ibmFpbFNlcnZpY2U@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7108471/","name":"Kelly Crifer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4911970/","name":"Leo Pyrata"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4498129/","name":"Grace Passô"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5506211/","name":"Gabriel Martins"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5668454/","name":"Maurílio Martins"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0432382/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5506211/","name":"Gabriel Martins"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5668454/","name":"Maurílio Martins"}],"duration":"PT2H1M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Fellwechselzeit
Pora wylinki
Fellwechselzeit
programme.desc: Fellwechselzeit: Directed by Sabrina Mertens. With Zelda Espenschied, Miriam Schiweck, Freya Kreutzkam, Bernd Wolf. The still life of a family in 57 pictures. Germany in the 1970ies. Stephanie is an intelligent and lively child. But she leads an isolated life with her parents, marked by the symbiotic bonding with her mentally unstable mother. A mother who has never really left her own childhood behind and who lives amidst things of the past and the memories connected to them. Stephanie's relationship with her father is one of mistrust. The passing years only bring aging, but no future. Unspoken thoughts lurk underneath the surface of everyday life. So Stephanie retreats into a dark world of barbaric fantasies, that are nourished by the traces of the past and only belong to her alone. One day, however, Stephanie's secret invades the family's reality." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11758900/","name":"Fellwechselzeit","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGFkZGQ2ODctZjViOS00Yjc0LThjZjctZjg1YzliNTRlMDVlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODU2NjIzMjc@._V1_.jpg","description":"The still life of a family in 57 pictures. Germany in the 1970ies. Stephanie is an intelligent and lively child. But she leads an isolated life with her parents, marked by the symbiotic bonding with her mentally unstable mother. IMDb data; ttnr: 11758900, Title: Fellwechselzeit, --- Description: Fellwechselzeit: Directed by Sabrina Mertens. With Zelda Espenschied, Miriam Schiweck, Freya Kreutzkam, Bernd Wolf. The still life of a family in 57 pictures. Germany in the 1970ies. Stephanie is an intelligent and lively child. But she leads an isolated life with her parents, marked by the symbiotic bonding with her mentally unstable mother. A mother who has never really left her own childhood behind and who lives amidst things of the past and the memories connected to them. Stephanie's relationship with her father is one of mistrust. The passing years only bring aging, but no future. Unspoken thoughts lurk underneath the surface of everyday life. So Stephanie retreats into a dark world of barbaric fantasies, that are nourished by the traces of the past and only belong to her alone. programme.desc:

After an accident, a little dog remembers all the different masters she's had successively and loved unconditionally." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6785292/","name":"L'extraordinaire voyage de Marona","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTFmNTk2YTUtZTk0Ni00MGU3LWIxYjktMDdjMWZiOTUxZmIxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTY5NTEwOTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"After an accident, a little dog remembers all the different masters she's had successively and loved unconditionally.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6785292/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"pperna-16598"},"dateCreated":"2021-03-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Humans and Dogs","reviewBody":"This is probably most impressive movie about relationship between dogs and humans...But that is just a cover or carrier wave. Its about true love and happiness. Made me think about humans and their false feeling of happines.

The style of animation is so impressive , remind me Waking live. Made me feel her ability to appreciate every little touch of a person that can share love , also ability to understand and let go beloved person to make that person happy. If half of humans are like Istvan, world would be such a beatufil place ....

I really feel ashamed being human now, and wish to be more like dog, cat or animal (maybe because i am dog in chinese cal. ). Now like 40 minutes after watching it i still cry like i havent cried for years.

Bless the authors of this masterpiece. programme.title: Play It Again, Sam
Zagraj to jeszcze raz, Sam
Play It Again, Sam
programme.desc:
Play It Again, Sam: Directed by Herbert Ross. With Woody Allen, Diane Keaton, Tony Roberts, Jerry Lacy. A neurotic film critic obsessed with the movie Casablanca (1942) attempts to get over his wife leaving him by dating again with the help of a married couple and his illusory idol, Humphrey Bogart." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0069097/","name":"Play It Again, Sam","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTI2ODBiNmQtY2RmZC00Yzg3LWI4MWYtMjE4OTA0NWRmZjY0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjUxODE0MDY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A neurotic film critic obsessed with the movie Casablanca (1942) attempts to get over his wife leaving him by dating again with the help of a married couple and his illusory idol, Humphrey Bogart.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0069097/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"w2amarketing"},"dateCreated":"2002-09-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"See "Casablanca" First","reviewBody":"My first and foremost thought about this movie is that you MUST see "Casablanca" (1942) first, for two reasons:

First, "Play it Again, Sam" contains not only archival footage from the 1942 classic, but numerous dialogic and other references which would be lost on someone who hasn't seen "Casablanca."

Second, and more important, is that the surprise ending of "Casablanca" is revealed in the *very first scene* of "Play it again, Sam."

Beyond that, "Play it again, Sam" is probably second only to "Annie Hall" among the Woody Allen / Diane Keaton films. Woody fans will enjoy the neurotic, psychosexual ramblings of the central character, which are typical of his movies, as well as the numerous elements of physical comedy, which are not as common in Woody Allen films. And watch for the scene in the art gallery -- it's a classic!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":25646,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"1972-05-05","keywords":"fantasy sequence,airport,farce,role model,date","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000095/","name":"Woody Allen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000473/","name":"Diane Keaton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0731634/","name":"Tony Roberts"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0006889/","name":"Herbert Ross"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0100349/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007764/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000095/","name":"Woody Allen"}],"duration":"PT1H25M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Jojo Rabbit
Jojo Rabbit
programme.desc:
Jojo Rabbit: Directed by Taika Waititi. With Roman Griffin Davis, Thomasin McKenzie, Scarlett Johansson, Taika Waititi. A young boy in Hitler's army finds out his mother is hiding a Jewish girl in their home." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2584384/","name":"Jojo Rabbit","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjU0Yzk2MzEtMjAzYy00MzY0LTg2YmItM2RkNzdkY2ZhN2JkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDg4NjY5OTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young boy in Hitler's army finds out his mother is hiding a Jewish girl in their home.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2584384/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"blairpedersen"},"dateCreated":"2019-11-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Humanity at its best","reviewBody":"So good. Taika makes you experience joy, terror, love, hate all in one minute and then he jumps out and runs around in a Hitler costume.

It's historically accurate too showing the polarisation of Germany during war time, indoctrination into the hitler youth and the storming of Berlin.

programme.title: Radio Flyer
Marzyciele, czyli potęga wyobraźni
Radio Flyer
programme.desc: Radio Flyer: Directed by Richard Donner, David Mickey Evans. With Lorraine Bracco, John Heard, Adam Baldwin, Elijah Wood. A father recounts a dark period of his childhood when he and his little brother lived in the suburbs." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0105211/","name":"Radio Flyer","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDc4ZjBkYzEtYzc2OS00YTUyLWI4OWItMTY3NDRlNWJhYTlhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A father recounts a dark period of his childhood when he and his little brother lived in the suburbs.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0105211/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"zootsuit98"},"dateCreated":"2005-03-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"classic","reviewBody":"In reply to "State of Confusion" The dogs injuries do seem to disappear rather abruptly, but that may have only been an error in continuity. But, as for the kids trying to build a plane out of junk, it's just a simple matter of imagination. These are two very young kids who have extremely active imaginations and they must rely on those imaginations to keep themselves from being exposed to the reality of the level of abuse that goes on in their home from their stepfather. As for the stepfather, it's very interesting that the director chose to no show his face. That makes him seem more monstrous. If you show his face, then that character becomes a person and not just this "monster" who is terrorizing the childhood of these two innocent children. By showing only the concequences of his abuse and not focusing scenes on the abuse itself, the children then become the main focus of the movie. This film has no loose ends, but runs just as a father's tale to his children would. It has embelleshments. This is a fine American classic.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12980,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"1992-02-21","keywords":"radio flyer,physical abuse,stepfather stepson relationship,told in flashback,mother son relationship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Radio Flyer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3955229465","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTE5MzQ2YTgtMzQ2ZS00MTk3LWIxNzEtN2MzZTBmYjdlNzE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTE5MzQ2YTgtMzQ2ZS00MTk3LWIxNzEtN2MzZTBmYjdlNzE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Columbia Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000966/","name":"Lorraine Bracco"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001334/","name":"John Heard"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000284/","name":"Adam Baldwin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001149/","name":"Richard Donner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0262693/","name":"David Mickey Evans"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014288/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0116435/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0262693/","name":"David Mickey Evans"}],"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Family Romance, LLC
Spółka rodzinna
Family Romance, LLC
programme.desc:
Family Romance, LLC: Directed by Werner Herzog. With Ishii Yuichi, Mahiro Tanimoto, Miki Fujimaki, Takashi Nakatani. A man is hired to impersonate the missing father of a young girl." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10208194/","name":"Family Romance, LLC","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWZhYjc1NjAtNzgzYy00OGQzLWI5ZDAtMWU2ZjI3OTljZTY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODY0MDM5Njk@._V1_.jpg","description":"A man is hired to impersonate the missing father of a young girl.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10208194/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"philip-davies31"},"dateCreated":"2020-07-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Japan's culture is still very strange to us.","reviewBody":"Surely that utterly dishonest Japanese substitution and impersonation of real persons in real situations is just weird, and wrong? Confusing psychodrama and reality as if there is no difference says something disturbing about the Japanese sense of self. Any Westerner would find such a practice a disturbing and offensive intrusion into and offensive parody of their personal integrity.

In the West we can accept role-playing dramas, which often have satisfying or even cathartic effects, because the illusion is a temporary imaginary leap, and the experience an exercise in self-analysis and mindfulness. Lessons are drawn which can be applied back in one's real life, having been a recreation that strengthens our emotional life, just as physical exercise strengthens our body. Well-written dramas can also impart this kind of creative refreshment. But the Japanese acceptance of play-acting as essentially indistinguishable from actuality, and as having the identical moral standing of authentic behaviour, is surely a dangerous category confusion? This seems to be exposed as the film shows the difficulty the man finds in posing convincingly as the father of a young child while at the same time keeping his emotional distance - as it is stipulated he must as a condition of his employment. One thinks in the West of those unpleasant consequences where undercover security operations have led to the betrayal of the emotions and the lives of partners whom agents have fallen in love with, even married and had children by, in the guise of an entirely false persona. Court cases have tended to follow.

One can speculate that this disturbing insincerity, which can so easily turn into real but still cheating feelings, is only tolerable in a society and culture that within living memory was still highly formalised according to strict traditional imperatives, that dictated not only the physical but also, to an extreme degree, the interior life of the people. This deprived thought and action of any moral component, producing a culture - as is well known - of shame, instead of guilt; of dissimulation, not confession.

A society that recently valued only mere correct appearance remains vulnerable to such imposture, treating what we would deem impostors and deceivers exactly like authentic persons. If the Japanese still lack, to some degree, the moral centre to distinguish between mere artifice and psychological integrity, then their obsession with automata as acceptable simulacra of human beings, even without application of any Turing test to demonstrate actual sentience, is indicative.

I don't say the Japanese have no modern sensibility, of course. After the terrible debacle, in the Second World War, of their unique traditional world-view, they have finally entered the moral universe. However, it seems they do retain a residual psychological tendency that remains susceptible to mere appearances. IMDb data; ttnr: 10208194, Title: Family Romance, LLC, --- Description: Family Romance, LLC: Directed by Werner Herzog. With Ishii Yuichi, Mahiro Tanimoto, Miki Fujimaki, Takashi Nakatani. A man is hired to impersonate the missing father of a young girl." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10208194/","name":"Family Romance, LLC","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWZhYjc1NjAtNzgzYy00OGQzLWI5ZDAtMWU2ZjI3OTljZTY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODY0MDM5Njk@._V1_.jpg","description":"A man is hired to impersonate the missing father of a young girl.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10208194/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"philip-davies31","dateCreated":"2020-07-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Japan's culture is still very strange to us.","reviewBody":"Surely that utterly dishonest Japanese substitution and impersonation of real persons in real situations is just weird, and wrong? Confusing psychodrama and reality as if there is no difference says something disturbing about the Japanese sense of self. Any Westerner would find such a practice a disturbing and offensive intrusion into and offensive parody of their personal integrity.

In the West we can accept role-playing dramas, which often have satisfying or even cathartic effects, because the illusion is a temporary imaginary leap, and the experience an exercise in self-analysis and mindfulness. Lessons are drawn which can be applied back in one's real life, having been a recreation that strengthens our emotional life, just as physical exercise strengthens our body. Well-written dramas can also impart this kind of creative refreshment. But the Japanese acceptance of play-acting as essentially indistinguishable from actuality, and as having the identical moral standing of authentic behaviour, is surely a dangerous category confusion? This seems to be exposed as the film shows the difficulty the man finds in posing convincingly as the father of a young child while at the same time keeping his emotional distance - as it is stipulated he must as a condition of his employment. One thinks in the West of those unpleasant consequences where undercover security operations have led to the betrayal of the emotions and the lives of partners whom agents have fallen in love with, even married and had children by, in the guise of an entirely false persona. Court cases have tended to follow.

One can speculate that this disturbing insincerity, which can so easily turn into real but still cheating feelings, is only tolerable in a society and culture that within living memory was still highly formalised according to strict traditional imperatives, that dictated not only the physical but also, to an extreme degree, the interior life of the people. This deprived thought and action of any moral component, producing a culture - as is well known - of shame, instead of guilt; of dissimulation, not confession.

A society that recently valued only mere correct appearance remains vulnerable to such imposture, treating what we would deem impostors and deceivers exactly like authentic persons. If the Japanese still lack, to some degree, the moral centre to distinguish between mere artifice and psychological integrity, then their obsession with automata as acceptable simulacra of human beings, even without application of any Turing test to demonstrate actual sentience, is indicative.

I don't say the Japanese have no modern sensibility, of course. After the terrible debacle, in the Second World War, of their unique traditional world-view, they have finally entered the moral universe. However, it seems they do retain a residual psychological tendency that remains susceptible to mere appearances. This has led them seriously astray (I suggest) in the current practice, as it is shown by this interesting Herzog film, 'Family Romance.'","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2248,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-07-03","keywords":"young girl,father,rent,japan,cherry blossom","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1826995225","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmVkYjI1NzQtY2ZlOC00NzQyLWJjN2ItYmEzZDIxNWFiMWNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmVkYjI1NzQtY2ZlOC00NzQyLWJjN2ItYmEzZDIxNWFiMWNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A man is hired to impersonate the missing father of a 12 year old girl.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10348089/","name":"Ishii Yuichi","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10640857/","name":"Mahiro Tanimoto","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm11334855/","name":"Miki Fujimaki"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001348/","name":"Werner Herzog"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0361457/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001348/","name":"Werner Herzog"],"duration":"PT1H29M"</script><metacontent="

Pilátus
programme.desc: Pilátus: Directed by Linda Dombrovszky. With Ildikó Hámori, Anna Györgyi, Zsolt Kovács, Sándor Terhes. The mother loves her daughter; the daughter loves her mother. The tragedy of misunderstood love. The adaptation of Magda Szabó's novel translated into twelve languages." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10398080/","name":"Pilátus","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTZmMWIyZGYtZDZlZS00YWVkLTlhZjMtNGE4YjM4OWYxZTkwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzM3NzY3NTc@._V1_.jpg","description":"The mother loves her daughter; the daughter loves her mother. The tragedy of misunderstood love. The adaptation of Magda Szabó's novel translated into twelve languages.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10398080/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"chrishastings1066"},"dateCreated":"2020-10-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Hauntingly beautiful","reviewBody":"I saw this as the very opening film of the Satisfied Eye International Film Festival and what an opener it was. Quietly, compellingly, utterly devastatingly beautiful storytelling on screen. Lingering and so full of sub-text, Pilate is an absolute bravura piece of filmmaking where every moment and every silence is laced with meaning and heartache. So much is left unsaid, so many things left unfinished. And that is the whole point. A brutally honest rumination on old age and grief and family dysfunction, the lead actress is wonderful, ably supported by the cast around her. The score and cinematography are beautiful. I honestly couldn't stop watching it. I wanted to take in every second of what the camera was capturing for me, like admiring a great work of art in a museum.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":124,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-01-29","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0405418/","name":"Ildikó Hámori"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0350587/","name":"Anna Györgyi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0468514/","name":"Zsolt Kovács"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2843398/","name":"Linda Dombrovszky"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0747074/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4302531/","name":"György Somogyi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0843651/","name":"Magda Szabó"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2703215/","name":"Sándor Szélesi"}]}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Rialto
Rialto
programme.desc: Rialto: Directed by Peter Mackie Burns. With Tom Vaughan-Lawlor, Tom Glynn-Carney, Monica Dolan, Sophie Jo Wasson. Colm, mid-40s has a comfortable life: a managerial job in Dublin's docks, two teenage children, and a kind, loyal wife in Claire. After the death of his father, a destructive figure, Colm's emotional life cracks open, and his downward spiral continues when he is made redundant. Drinking heavily and unable to confide in Claire, Colm finds himself drawn to Jay, a 19-year-old who dabbles in prostitution. Their sexual encounters and tentative friendship become Colm's only solace - but this recklessness puts his family-life at risk." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8818842/","name":"Rialto","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmE2NGQ5ZDgtM2E3OS00Mjc3LTliMDAtOTY5NTA4MTRhOTU5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjYxMDU0OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Colm, mid-40s has a comfortable life: a managerial job in Dublin's docks, two teenage children, and a kind, loyal wife in Claire. After the death of his father, a destructive figure, Colm's emotional life cracks open, and his downwar","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8818842/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jromanbaker"},"dateCreated":"2020-07-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Very fine film","reviewBody":"This is a modern tragedy that reminded me of Buchner's ' Wozzeck ' and Thomas Mann's ' Death in Venice '. A 46 year old man is at the end of his tether, and all around him are strangers in his family who do not know him, and strangers outside of him who deprive him of the only job he has ever had. He loves only an inaccessible youth and like Aschenbach in ' Death in Venice ' he sees him as the embodiment of beauty, when the youth is all too pathetically human. The film is anything but rough in its direction, and the acting is superb. It is not an easy film to watch, but then the finest works of art are ( and should be ) challenging and difficult. The music underlines this and rarely has music been so well used. There is a scene in mud fields that moved me a lot and the music in that scene was excellent and added to the ' Wozzeck ' feel I had throughout the film. It had echoes of Alban Berg who put the Buchner play to music and made it one of the greatest and hardest Opera's to watch and bear. But like all works that work at the highest level ' Rialto ' left me with a gift, and that is the gift of further understanding mankind, and the complexities of being human, plus the extremities of abuse that are inflicted constantly on us as human beings. Rialto was that part of Venice where Aschenbach stayed in ' Death in Venice '. A painful but necessary gem that validates the art of film supremely.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":631,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-10-02","keywords":"gay interest,loss of job,dysfunctional marriage,father son relationship,gay sex","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1155842329","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzFlNzQyYzQtYTljMS00NzllLWE0OTQtOGEyZDM5NTk3ZDBlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzFlNzQyYzQtYTljMS00NzllLWE0OTQtOGEyZDM5NTk3ZDBlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Colm, mid-40s has a comfortable life: a managerial job in Dublin's docks, two teenage children, and a kind, loyal wife in Claire. IMDb data; ttnr: 8818842, Title: Rialto, --- Description: Rialto: Directed by Peter Mackie Burns. With Tom Vaughan-Lawlor, Tom Glynn-Carney, Monica Dolan, Sophie Jo Wasson. Colm, mid-40s has a comfortable life: a managerial job in Dublin's docks, two teenage children, and a kind, loyal wife in Claire. After the death of his father, a destructive figure, Colm's emotional life cracks open, and his downward spiral continues when he is made redundant. Drinking heavily and unable to confide in Claire, Colm finds himself drawn to Jay, a 19-year-old who dabbles in prostitution. Their sexual encounters and tentative friendship become Colm's only solace - but this recklessness puts his family-life at risk." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8818842/","name":"Rialto","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmE2NGQ5ZDgtM2E3OS00Mjc3LTliMDAtOTY5NTA4MTRhOTU5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjYxMDU0OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Colm, mid-40s has a comfortable life: a managerial job in Dublin's docks, two teenage children, and a kind, loyal wife in Claire. After the death of his father, a destructive figure, Colm's emotional life cracks open, and his downwar","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8818842/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"jromanbaker","dateCreated":"2020-07-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Very fine film","reviewBody":"This is a modern tragedy that reminded me of Buchner's ' Wozzeck ' and Thomas Mann's ' Death in Venice '. A 46 year old man is at the end of his tether, and all around him are strangers in his family who do not know him, and strangers outside of him who deprive him of the only job he has ever had. He loves only an inaccessible youth and like Aschenbach in ' Death in Venice ' he sees him as the embodiment of beauty, when the youth is all too pathetically human. The film is anything but rough in its direction, and the acting is superb. It is not an easy film to watch, but then the finest works of art are ( and should be ) challenging and difficult. The music underlines this and rarely has music been so well used. There is a scene in mud fields that moved me a lot and the music in that scene was excellent and added to the ' Wozzeck ' feel I had throughout the film. It had echoes of Alban Berg who put the Buchner play to music and made it one of the greatest and hardest Opera's to watch and bear. But like all works that work at the highest level ' Rialto ' left me with a gift, and that is the gift of further understanding mankind, and the complexities of being human, plus the extremities of abuse that are inflicted constantly on us as human beings. Rialto was that part of Venice where Aschenbach stayed in ' Death in Venice '. A painful but necessary gem that validates the art of film supremely.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":631,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1,"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-10-02","keywords":"gay interest,loss of job,dysfunctional marriage,father son relationship,gay sex","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1155842329","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzFlNzQyYzQtYTljMS00NzllLWE0OTQtOGEyZDM5NTk3ZDBlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzFlNzQyYzQtYTljMS00NzllLWE0OTQtOGEyZDM5NTk3ZDBlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Colm, mid-40s has a comfortable life: a managerial job in Dublin's docks, two teenage children, and a kind, loyal wife in Claire. programme.title: Werk ohne Autor
Obrazy bez autora
Werk ohne Autor
programme.desc:
Werk ohne Autor: Directed by Florian Henckel von Donnersmarck. With Tom Schilling, Sebastian Koch, Paula Beer, Saskia Rosendahl. German artist Kurt Barnert has escaped East Germany and now lives in West Germany, but is tormented by his childhood under the Nazis and the GDR-regime." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5311542/","name":"Werk ohne Autor","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGUwYTQxZDYtYTZlMy00YmVhLTkyOTYtOTUwMzI2NTBlOWNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTM2NTg3Nzg@._V1_.jpg","description":"German artist Kurt Barnert has escaped East Germany and now lives in West Germany, but is tormented by his childhood under the Nazis and the GDR-regime.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5311542/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jrwygant"},"dateCreated":"2020-02-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"A tale for today","reviewBody":""Never Look Away" is essentially a film about three characters: a young artist, based on the life of Gerhard Richter, his wife, and his wife's father, a former Nazi who worked as a doctor committed to "purifying" the German race. So with the focus held so tightly on just three characters, it may seem surprising that it takes three hours to tell the story. But this film never left the feeling that too much was being told. It is a masterpiece of ideal personal relationships set against a background of truly evil and destructive behavior.

The story begins with the artist as a young boy in the care of his devoted but slightly strange aunt. We follow the artist into young adulthood and into a marriage that faces unique challenges. He carries with him his aunt's plea to "never look away."

While this tale begins at the onset of the Nazi era, much of what is presented is relevant to our contemporary world, though those political parallels are not drawn explicitly in the film.

Released in 2018, this film was honored with many award nominations and a few wins. Because of subtitles and a length of three hours, "Never Look Away" did not lend itself well to American tastes or to wide theatrical distribution. It is available on DVD or streaming and should not be missed.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":18762,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2018-10-03","keywords":"east germany,painter,doctor,forced abortion,pregnancy","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"U.S. Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1224587801","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMThhNzU3YTktOTgwZS00OTY0LTgwNDctYmI1YWIyYTA1YjA4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMThhNzU3YTktOTgwZS00OTY0LTgwNDctYmI1YWIyYTA1YjA4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"'Never Look Away' follows thirty years in the life of artist Kurt Barnert (a character loosely based on Gerhard Richter). From a childhood witnessing Nazi Germany to life in post-war East Berlin."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0771713/","name":"Tom Schilling"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0462407/","name":"Sebastian Koch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3559009/","name":"Paula Beer"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003697/","name":"Florian Henckel von Donnersmarck"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0569143/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008261/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0128215/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003697/","name":"Florian Henckel von Donnersmarck"}],"duration":"PT3H9M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Chinatown
Chinatown
programme.desc: Chinatown: Directed by Roman Polanski. With Jack Nicholson, Faye Dunaway, John Huston, Perry Lopez. A private detective hired to expose an adulterer finds himself caught up in a web of deceit, corruption, and murder." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0071315/","name":"Chinatown","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGMwYmY5ZmEtMzY1Yi00OWJiLTk1Y2MtMzI2MjBhYmZkNTQ0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzkwMjQ5NzM@._V1_.jpg","description":"A private detective hired to expose an adulterer finds himself caught up in a web of deceit, corruption, and murder.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0071315/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"BlackJack_B"},"dateCreated":"2001-11-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Gittes gits it done.","reviewBody":"Truly deserving of its title as one of the greatest films of all time, Chinatown delivers in spades. Everything about the film shines, and it looks better now than it probably did in 1974; of course, there's a lot of junk in the theaters these days. Acting, cinematography, script, atmosphere, it's all 10s baby. The story of a struggling P.I. getting a case that has more twists and turns than a mountain road is still one of the most crafted storylines ever concocted. Jack Nicholson, Faye Dunaway, John Huston, John Hillerman, and everyone else deliver superb performances. Robert Towne's script, John A. Alonzo's camerawork, and Polanski's direction all make this a classic. You can't be a movie buff if you haven't seen this one."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":309227,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1974-06-20","keywords":"neo noir,private detective,femme fatale,detective,police","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Chinatown","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1220411673","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjY0NzViNDYtMzQ1My00NTlhLWJjYzEtNTNhNjZiZDczN2VlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjY0NzViNDYtMzQ1My00NTlhLWJjYzEtNTNhNjZiZDczN2VlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Paramount"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000197/","name":"Jack Nicholson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001159/","name":"Faye Dunaway"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001379/","name":"John Huston"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000591/","name":"Roman Polanski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0001235/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044146/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001801/","name":"Robert Towne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000591/","name":"Roman Polanski"}],"duration":"PT2H10M"}</script><metacontent="

Niki has just turned 35 and has to suddenly grasp all the life choices and relationships that she dug for." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11173524/","name":"Ring Mamma!","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWIxYTdkMjAtNjRlYS00MjIwLTgyYjItZGEzOWJhZTMxZjk4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTY5MzE5NDA@._V1_.jpg","description":"Niki has just turned 35 and has to suddenly grasp all the life choices and relationships that she dug for.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11173524/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"thomasrorby"},"dateCreated":"2020-12-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"A sign of the time?","reviewBody":"If all Millennials are like the characters in this so-called Feelgood movie, then we're doomed even without Climate Crisis... Projām
programme.desc: Away: Directed by Gints Zilbalodis. A boy and a little bird are on a journey across a strange island trying to get back home." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8288450/","name":"Away","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWE1ZTBhYWYtNmZkYy00MGZjLTgzMmYtYTYyMzg5M2VkOTQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzYzNjgzNDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"A boy and a little bird are on a journey across a strange island trying to get back home.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8288450/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"CinemaSerf"},"dateCreated":"2020-09-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"No dialogue, no problem though...","reviewBody":"A young boy comes to, hanging by his parachute from a tree. When a large dark creature approaches him, he senses this is no ally and manages to escape to begin a curious journey through this strange land trying to get home. His journey is told in episode form, each offering us an engaging instalment of his adventures during which he encounters and befriends a small, yellow, bird and finds a motor bike on which they try to stay one step ahead of their lumbering, pursuing, nemesis. The storyline is intriguing, there is a gentle sense of menace from the pursuing "monster" - perhaps it is death - and the animation is clear and colourful. I have to say, I disliked the score - way too much, repetitive and frequently distracting from an otherwise charming little story of determination and companionship. Well worth watch.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1123,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"genre":["Animation","Adventure","Family"],"datePublished":"2019-11-15","keywords":"boy","director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6478535/","name":"Gints Zilbalodis"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0628073/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6478535/","name":"Gints Zilbalodis"}],"duration":"PT1H15M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Family Romance, LLC
Spółka rodzinna
Family Romance, LLC
programme.desc:
Family Romance, LLC: Directed by Werner Herzog. With Ishii Yuichi, Mahiro Tanimoto, Miki Fujimaki, Takashi Nakatani. A man is hired to impersonate the missing father of a young girl." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10208194/","name":"Family Romance, LLC","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWZhYjc1NjAtNzgzYy00OGQzLWI5ZDAtMWU2ZjI3OTljZTY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODY0MDM5Njk@._V1_.jpg","description":"A man is hired to impersonate the missing father of a young girl.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10208194/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"philip-davies31"},"dateCreated":"2020-07-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Japan's culture is still very strange to us.","reviewBody":"Surely that utterly dishonest Japanese substitution and impersonation of real persons in real situations is just weird, and wrong? Confusing psychodrama and reality as if there is no difference says something disturbing about the Japanese sense of self. Any Westerner would find such a practice a disturbing and offensive intrusion into and offensive parody of their personal integrity.

In the West we can accept role-playing dramas, which often have satisfying or even cathartic effects, because the illusion is a temporary imaginary leap, and the experience an exercise in self-analysis and mindfulness. Lessons are drawn which can be applied back in one's real life, having been a recreation that strengthens our emotional life, just as physical exercise strengthens our body. Well-written dramas can also impart this kind of creative refreshment. But the Japanese acceptance of play-acting as essentially indistinguishable from actuality, and as having the identical moral standing of authentic behaviour, is surely a dangerous category confusion? This seems to be exposed as the film shows the difficulty the man finds in posing convincingly as the father of a young child while at the same time keeping his emotional distance - as it is stipulated he must as a condition of his employment. One thinks in the West of those unpleasant consequences where undercover security operations have led to the betrayal of the emotions and the lives of partners whom agents have fallen in love with, even married and had children by, in the guise of an entirely false persona. Court cases have tended to follow.

One can speculate that this disturbing insincerity, which can so easily turn into real but still cheating feelings, is only tolerable in a society and culture that within living memory was still highly formalised according to strict traditional imperatives, that dictated not only the physical but also, to an extreme degree, the interior life of the people. This deprived thought and action of any moral component, producing a culture - as is well known - of shame, instead of guilt; of dissimulation, not confession.

A society that recently valued only mere correct appearance remains vulnerable to such imposture, treating what we would deem impostors and deceivers exactly like authentic persons. If the Japanese still lack, to some degree, the moral centre to distinguish between mere artifice and psychological integrity, then their obsession with automata as acceptable simulacra of human beings, even without application of any Turing test to demonstrate actual sentience, is indicative.

I don't say the Japanese have no modern sensibility, of course. After the terrible debacle, in the Second World War, of their unique traditional world-view, they have finally entered the moral universe. However, it seems they do retain a residual psychological tendency that remains susceptible to mere appearances. This has led them seriously astray (I suggest) in the current practice, as it is shown by this interesting Herzog film, 'Family Romance.'","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2248,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-07-03","keywords":"young girl,father,rent,japan,cherry blossom","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1826995225","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmVkYjI1NzQtY2ZlOC00NzQyLWJjN2ItYmEzZDIxNWFiMWNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmVkYjI1NzQtY2ZlOC00NzQyLWJjN2ItYmEzZDIxNWFiMWNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A man is hired to impersonate the missing father of a 12 year old girl."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10348089/","name":"Ishii Yuichi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10640857/","name":"Mahiro Tanimoto"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm11334855/","name":"Miki Fujimaki"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001348/","name":"Werner Herzog"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0361457/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001348/","name":"Werner Herzog"}],"duration":"PT1H29M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Voir le jour
Na świat
Voir le jour
programme.desc: Voir le jour: Directed by Marion Laine. With Sandrine Bonnaire, Brigitte Roüan, Aure Atika, Sarah Stern. Jeanne works in a maternity yard in Marseille. Day and night, she struggles with her colleagues to support the mothers and their babies." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11154574/","name":"Voir le jour","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjBkMDgzNWUtZmFjMy00MTY2LTljMGEtNjkyMzc3ZjAxMjhkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTAwMzM3NDI3._V1_.jpg","description":"Jeanne works in a maternity yard in Marseille. Day and night, she struggles with her colleagues to support the mothers and their babies.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11154574/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ulicknormanowen"},"dateCreated":"2021-03-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"A nurse's work is never done.","reviewBody":"It could not have come at a better time,this tribute to the staff of a maternity hospital:midwives, nurses, nurses' aides .I could do without Bonnaire's rock singer past and her daughter's clichéed frames of mind ;the gist of the movie , which takes place in the maternity is close to documentary ,and Sandrine Bonnaire is not really the star , all the actresses are admirable: the midwife (Brigitte Rouan ) did not choose this job -she wanted to become a doctor- but her work has become her raison d'être ,in spite of moments of despondency .These underpaid women 's commitment to their work is extraordinary: from the nurses' aide who rocks a crying baby to sleep to Bonnaire who literally saves a baby -and there's won't be any vainglory or legion d'honneur -;one feels the compassion ,the camaraderie ,the solidarity when one of them is held responsible for the death of a baby ,the joie de vivre when ,during a rebellion against the inhuman working conditions (a meager bonus of 20 euros for night work ) , they break into a song "mamy blue" which cheers them up. Even though sometimes they quarrel or meet people at the door shouting against the termination of pregnancy.\n\nThe first sequence sums it up in an admirably succint style: too many patients , shortstaffed nurses and others...","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":108,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-08-12","keywords":"mother,midwife,maternity","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi845725209","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODg1YTZlZmYtY2ZiYy00ZWFlLThmNTItOWIwZTc5NzVlYWY4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODg1YTZlZmYtY2ZiYy00ZWFlLThmNTItOWIwZTc5NzVlYWY4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0094789/","name":"Sandrine Bonnaire"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0747690/","name":"Brigitte Roüan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004133/","name":"Aure Atika"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0481866/","name":"Marion Laine"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0486596/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028557/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0624903/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1125358/","name":"Julie Bonnie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0481866/","name":"Marion Laine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8279997/","name":"Laura Piani"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

Day and night, she struggles with her colleagues to support the mothers and their babies.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11154574/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"ulicknormanowen","dateCreated":"2021-03-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"A nurse's work is never done.","reviewBody":"It could not have come at a better time,this tribute to the staff of a maternity hospital:midwives, nurses, nurses' aides .I could do without Bonnaire's rock singer past and her daughter's clichéed frames of mind ;the gist of the movie , which takes place in the maternity is close to documentary ,and Sandrine Bonnaire is not really the star , all the actresses are admirable: the midwife (Brigitte Rouan ) did not choose this job -she wanted to become a doctor- but her work has become her raison d'être ,in spite of moments of despondency .These underpaid women 's commitment to their work is extraordinary: from the nurses' aide who rocks a crying baby to sleep to Bonnaire who literally saves a baby -and there's won't be any vainglory or legion d'honneur -;one feels the compassion ,the camaraderie ,the solidarity when one of them is held responsible for the death of a baby ,the joie de vivre when ,during a rebellion against the inhuman working conditions (a meager bonus of 20 euros for night work ) , they break into a song "mamy blue" which cheers them up. Even though sometimes they quarrel or meet people at the door shouting against the termination of pregnancy.\n\nThe first sequence sums it up in an admirably succint style: too many patients , shortstaffed nurses and others...","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":108,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9,"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-08-12","keywords":"mother,midwife,maternity","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi845725209","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODg1YTZlZmYtY2ZiYy00ZWFlLThmNTItOWIwZTc5NzVlYWY4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODg1YTZlZmYtY2ZiYy00ZWFlLThmNTItOWIwZTc5NzVlYWY4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0094789/","name":"Sandrine Bonnaire","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0747690/","name":"Brigitte Roüan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004133/","name":"Aure Atika"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0481866/","name":"Marion Laine"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0486596/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028557/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0624903/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1125358/","name":"Julie Bonnie","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0481866/","name":"Marion Laine","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8279997/","name":"Laura Piani"],"duration":"PT1H31M"</script><metacontent="
